description: Period of the stationary component of the pattern which a row of n cells becomes in Conway's Game of Life.
comments: For n = 56, the pattern produces gliders and thus does not oscillate in the truest sense of the word. For n = 57, no gliders are produced and a(57) = 2. There exists an N such that for all n >= N, the row of n alive cells produces gliders and thus does not oscillate. [_Nathaniel Johnston_, Jun 08 2009]
links: Eric M. Schmidt, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
LifeWiki, One cell thick pattern [From _Nathaniel Johnston_, Jun 08 2009]
example: a(10) = 15 because a line of 10 cells becomes the pentadecathlon.a(56) = 2 because a line of 56 cells becomes 4 gliders (which we ignore) and a remaining pattern of period 2. - _Eric M. Schmidt_, May 24 2014
author: Alex Fink (fink(AT)cadvision.com), Jun 06 2001
extensions: More general definition and sequence extended by _Eric M. Schmidt_, May 24 2014
